note.p: Birth: La Brede, near Bordeaux, France (18 January 1689)

Career: President a mortier in the Parliament of Bordeaux (1716); had problems with his eyesight; researched the weight and transparency of bodies, and the causes of echoes; published "Lettres persanes" (1721); visited several European countries, including England where he lived for two years (1729-1731); his "De l'esprit des lois" was placed on the Index (1748); was blind by the time he died
Memberships: Academie des Sciences (1728)); Academie de Bordeaux (1716); Freemason
Proposers: George Lewis Teissier; Paul de St Hyacinthe; Sir Hans Sloane
References: P Casini, 'Newton's Principia and the Philosophers of the Enlightenment' in NR 1988 vol 42 pp 35-52
